metadata.title: CVE-2022-48788 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:nvme-rdma: fix possible use-after-free in transport error_recovery workWhile nvme_rdma_submit_async_event_work is checking the ctrl and queuestate before preparing the AER command and scheduling io_work, in orderto fully prevent a race where this check is not reliable the errorrecovery work must flush async_event_work before continuing to destroythe admin queue after setting the ctrl state to RESETTING such thatthere is no race .submit_async_event and the error recovery handleritself changing the ctrl state.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48788` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required
